charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of seventy-eight months on each count to run concurrently. The Court imposes a fine of $1000.00 on Count 1 only. While incarcerated, payments shal l be made according to defendants UNICOR status. While on supervised release, defendant shall make timely installments at the rate of $25.00 per month. Full payment of the fine is due at least three months prior to the expiration of supervision. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of eight years on each count to run concurrently. Within 72 hours of release from custody of the Bureau of Prisons, defendant shall report to the probation office i n the district to which released. Conditions of supervised release as follows: Defendant shall not commit any other crimes; shall not possess a firearm or other dangerous device; shall not possess a controlled substance; shall comply with the standar d conditions that have been adopted by this Court; shall provide the U.S. Probation Office with access to any requested financial information. If restitution or fine is owed, defendant shall notify the U.S. Probation Office of any assets received and shall not disburse his interest in any assets, including but not limited to, income tax refunds, inheritance, insurance and lawsuit settlements or gambling winnings without the approval of the U.S. Probation Office. Defendant shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug abuse, as directed by the probation officer, until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the probation officer. Defendant is required to contribute to the cost of services rendered (copay ment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant shall submit to a warrantless search of his person, residence, vehicle or other property under his control to insur e compliance with all conditions of supervision as determined by the probation officer. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each count for a total SPA $150.00. Court recommends the defendant be placed in a facility as close to Tucson, AZ. as possible and the defendant be placed in an Intensive Drug Treatment Program while incarcerated.

41 months incarceration on each count to run concurrently; 5 years supervised release on count 1 and one year on each of counts 4 and 5 to run concurrently; $2,000 fine; $50 SPA on each count for a total of $150.

It is adjudged that defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of thirty-seven months on each count all to run concurrently and to pay a fine of $3000.00 while incarcerated, fine payments t o be based on defendant's UNICOR status. Upon release from prison, defendant will be placed on supervised release for a term of four years, consisting of a term of four years on Count 1, one year on Counts 23-38 and a term of three years on Coun t 43 all terms to run concurrently. While on supervised release, defendant shall make timely installments at the rate of $50.00 a month. Full payment of the fine is due at least three months prior to the expiration of supervision. Within 72 hour s of release from the Bureau of Prisons, defendant shall report in person to the probation office in the district to which released. Conditions of supervised release as follows: Defendant shall not commit any federal, state, or local crimes; shall no t possess a firearm or other dangerous device; shall not possess a controlled substance; shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this Court; shall participate in a program of testing and treatment for drug abuse as directe d by the probation officer, until such time defendant is released from the program by the probation officer; shall be required to contribute to the cost of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment; shall submit, upon the request from the U.S. probation officer, to a warrantless search of his person, residence, vehicle, or any other property under his control to insure compliance with all c onditions of supervision; failure to submit to a search may be grounds for revocation; said search is to be based upon reasonable suspicion of contraband and/or evidence of a violation of a condition of supervision and is to be conducted in a reasona ble manner and at a reasonable time by the probation officer or authorized person under the immediate and personal supervision of the probation officer; the defendant shall inform any other residents that the premises may be subject to search pursuan t to this condition; any fine imposed by this judgment shall become a condition of supervision. Defendant to pay special assessment of $50.00 on each count for a total special assessment of $900.00. Defendant to self surrender to the facili ty when notified. Court recommends defendant serve a period of this sentence at the Intensive Confinement Center.

Defendant is placed on probation for a term of four years. Defendant to pay a fine of $1,000.00. Defendant to make timely installments at the rate of no less than $25.00 per month while on probation. Full payment of the fine is due at least three months prior to the expiration of supervision. Special conditions of probation: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this Court. Any fine that is imposed by this judgment shall become a condition of sup ervision. Defendant shall comply with conditions of home confinement for a period of six months. Defendant shall submit to urine testing and if indicated by the testing, is to complete a drug/alcohol evaluation and enter into any treatment as directe d by the probation office. Defendant is not to leave treatment until discharge is agreed to by the probation office and treating agency. If in treatment, defendant is to abstain from the use of alcohol. Defendant is required to contribute to the cost s ofservices rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00.

Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of three years on Counts 1 and 41 and one year on Counts 27, 28, 29 and 30 to run concurrently. Defendant is required to contribute to the cos ts of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Any fine imposed by this judgment shall become a condition of supervision. Defendant to pay SP A of $50.00 on each count for a total SPA of $300.00.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for imprisonment for a term of 6 months each on Counts 1, 2-9 and 20-26 all to be served concurrently. Court recommends the Bureau of Prisons designate the Community Correction Center (Sa lvation Army, Rochester, New York) for service of sentence. Upon relase from imprisonment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of three years consisting of 3 years on Count 1 and 1 year on each of Counts 2-9 and 20-26 all to be serve d concurrently. Special conditions of supervised release: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this Court. Defendant shall comply with conditions of home confinement for a period of six months. Defendant shall pay the cost of electronic monitoring services at the daily rate provided by the Probation Office. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each count for a total SPA of $800.00.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of 30 months on each count to be served concurrently. Defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 to be paid in timely installments on a scheule to be fixed by t he Bureau of Prisons while incarcerated and at the rate of $30.00 per month while on supervised release. Full payment of the fine is due at least three months prior tot he expiration of supervision. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is p laced on supervised rlease for a term of three years consisting of three years on Count 1, one year on each of Counts 31,32 and 33 and 3 years on Count 40 all to be served concurrently. Special conditions of release: Any fine imposed by this judgment shall become a condition of supervision. Defendant shall perform 100 hours of community service. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each cont for a total SPA of $250.00. Court recommends the defendant be placed in the Shock Incarceration Pr ogram of FCI Lewisburg. Defendant may self surrender to the facility when notified by the U.S. Marshal.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of twelve months on each count to run concurrently. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of three years consisting of three year s on Count 1 and one year on each of counts 34 and 35 all to be served concurrently. Special conditions of supervised release: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this Court. Defendant shall submit to rrine t esting and if indicated by the testing, is to complete a drug/alcohol evaluation and enter into any treatment as directed by the probation office. Defendant is not to leave treatment until discharge is agreed to by the probation office and treating a gency. If in treatment, defendant is to abstain from the use of alcohol. Defendant is required to contribute to the costs of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each count for a total SPA of $150.00. Court recommends the defendant be placed in the facility at Bradford, PA. Defendant shall self surrender to the U.S. Marshal when notified.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of thirty months on each count to run concurrently. Defendant to pay a fine of $750.00 on Count 1 and $250.00 on Count 36 for a total fine of $ 1000.00. While on supervised release, defendant shall make timely installments at the rate of no less than $30.00 per month. Full payment of the fine is due at least three months prior to the expiration of sueprvision. Upon release from imprison ment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of three years on Count 1 and one year on Count 36 to run concurrently. Special conditions of supervised release as follows: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditons that have been adopted by this Court. Any fine that is imposed by this judgment shall become a conditions of supervision. Defendant is required to contribute to the costs of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant to perfform 100 hours of community service as directed by the probation officer. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each count for a total SPA of $100.00. Court recommends that defendnt's term of imprisonment be served at the Intensive Confinement Center at Lewisburg, PA. Defendant may voluntarily surrender when notified by the U.S. Marshal.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of imprisonment of 21 months on each of Counts 1 through 19 to be served concurrently. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is place on supervised release for a term of th ree years on Count 1 and 1 year on each of Counts 2 through 19 all to be served concurrently. Within 72 hours of release from custody of the Burueau of Prisons, defendant shall report in person to the probation office in the district to which the def endant is released. Conditions of supervised release as follows: 1) Defendant shall not commit any federal, state or local crimes. 2) Defendant shall not possess a firearm or other dangerous device. 3) Defendant shall not possess a controlled substan ce. 4) Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court. 5) Defendant shall provide the probation officer with access to any requested financial information. 6) Defendant shall not incur new credit charges or o pen additional lines of credit without the approval of the probation officer. 7) Defendant is to submit to urine testing and if indicated by the testing, is to complete a drug/alchol evaluation as directed by the probation officer. Defendant is not t o leave treatment until discharge is agreed to by the probation officer and treating agency. If in treatment, defendant is to abstain from the use of alcohol. 8) Defendant is required to contribute to the costs of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or avaiability of third-party payment. 9) Defendant shall submit to a search of his person, residence, vehicle or any property under his control, to be conducted in a reasonabl e manner and at a reasonable time by the probation officer of any authorized person under the immediate and personal supervision of the probation officer to insure compliance with all conditions of supervised release. Defendant to pay SPA of $50 .00 on each of Counts 1 through 19 for a total SPA of $950.00. Defendant is immediately remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal.

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of ten months on each count to run concurrently. (Defendant pleads guilty to violation of special condition #2 of Violation) defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for imprisonment for a term of four months to run concurrently with the sentence imposed in 96-CR-6058. De fendant remains obligated for payment of the remainder of unpaid fine and special penalty assessment as set out in the original judgment. Upon completion of term of incarceration, defendant's term of supervised release will be satisfied with the exception of defendant's obligation for the unpaid monetary penalty and fine. (MAT)

De fendant remains obligated for payment of the remainder of unpaid fine and special penalty assessment as set out in the original judgment. Upon completion of term of incarceration, defendant's term of supervised release will be satisfied with the exception of defendant's obligation for the unpaid monetary penalty and fine. (MAT)

Defendant is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for incarceration for a term of twelve months on each count to run concurrently. The sentence of imprisonment shall run concurrent with the defendant's sentence in Monroe County Cour t on Indictment #825-94. Defendant to pay a fine of $250.00 on Count 1 and $250.00 on Count 15 for a total fine of $500.00. While on supervised release, defendant shall make timely installments at the rate of no less than $15 .00 per month. Upon release from imprisonment, defendant is placed on supervised release for a term of four years on Count 1 and a term of one year on Count 15 to run concurrently. Special conditions of sueprvised release as follows: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court. Any fine that is imposed by this judgment shall become a conditions of supervision. Defendant is required to contribute to the costs of services rendered (copayment) in an amou nt to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as directed by the probation officer. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00 on each count f or a total SPA of $100.

Special conditions of sueprvised release as follows: Defendant shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by this court. Any fine that is imposed by this judgment shall become a conditions of supervision. Re-Sentence. (Count 1) It is adjudged that the defendant is hereby placed on probation for a term of three years. Conditions of probation as follows: defendant shall not commit any federal, state or local crimes; shall not possess a firearm or other dangerous device; shall not possess a controlled substance; shall comply with the standard conditions that have been adopted by the Court; shall submit to urine testing and if indicated by the testing, is to complete a drug/alcohol evaluation and ent er into any treatment as directed by the probation office. Defendant is not to leave treatment until discharge is agreed to by the probation office and treating agency. If in treatment, defendant is to abstain from the use of alcohol. Defendant is re quired to contribute to the cost of services rendered (copayment) in an amount to be determined by the probation officer, based on ability to pay or availability of third-party payment. Defendant shall submit to a search of his person, residence, veh icle or any property under his control, to be conducted in a reasonable manner and at a reasonable time by the probation officer or any authorized person under the immediate and personal supervision of the probation officer to insure compliance with all conditions of release. Defendant to pay SPA of $50.00
